Class ContactsInfo

java.lang.Object
ContactsInfo
public class ContactsInfo extends Object
This class containts everything regarding the objects. Here we have the objects attributes, constructors, setters and getters and also the validation methods for the contacts infos

    • setPersonalID

      public boolean setPersonalID(String personalID)
      Checks the validation of the personal ID Calls the ID validation method to check the entered ID and returns true if the validation goes trough
      Parameters:
      personalID - the ID we want to validate
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the validation goes trough

    • setFirstName

      public boolean setFirstName(String firstName)
      Checks the validation of the first name Calls the Letters method and checks if the entered name contains only letters, goes trough the first name and adds +1 into a counter and if the counter matches the first names length, we have valid name
      Parameters:
      firstName - the name we want to validate
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the validation goes trough

    • setLastName

      public boolean setLastName(String lastName)
      Checks the validation of the last name Calls the Letters method and checks if the entered name contains only letters, goes trough the last name and adds +1 into a counter and if the counter matches the last names length, we have valid name
      Parameters:
      lastName - the name we want to validate
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the validation goes trough

    • setPhoneNumber

      public boolean setPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber)
      Checks the validation of the phone number Phone number is entered as a string, if the String is able to be parsed into a int value, then the phone number is validated
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - the number we want to validate
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the validation goes trough
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the phonenumber cant be parsed into int

    • setAddress

      public boolean setAddress(String address)
      No validation needed on the address it just adds the address into the objects attribute if entered
      Parameters:
      address - the address to be put into attribute
      Returns:
      true

    • setEmail

      public boolean setEmail(String email)
      Checks the validation of the email Calls the validEmail method to check if the email is valid, returns true if the validation goes trough, also works if the entered email is null because email is not mandatory information
      Parameters:
      email - the name we want to validate
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the validation goes trough

    • Letters

      public static boolean Letters(char chr)
      Checks if a charecter is between A-Z
      Parameters:
      chr - the charecter to be checked
      Returns:
      returns true or false depening on if the chr is between A-Z

    • validEmail

      public static boolean validEmail(String email)
      Checks if the entered email contains '@' sign
      Parameters:
      email - the email that is to be validated
      Returns:
      true or false depending on if the email contains @

    • validID

      public static boolean validID(String personalID)
      Checks if the entered ID is up to the Finnish ID standards
      Parameters:
      personalID - the ID that is to be valitated
      Returns:
      true or false depending on if the ID is up to Finnish ID standards
